metadata.title: CVE-2021-20333 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Certified (xenial) - medium
metadata.description: Sending specially crafted commands to a MongoDB Server may result inartificial log entries being generated or for log entries to be split. Thisissue affects MongoDB Server v3.6 versions prior to 3.6.20; MongoDB Serverv4.0 versions prior to 4.0.21 and MongoDB Server v4.2 versions prior to4.2.10.

criterions.comment: mongodb: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
